item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "America...just a nation of two hundred million used car salesmen with all the money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the world who tries to make us uncomfortable" -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "In a nation run by swine, all pigs are upward-mobile and the rest of us are fucked until we can put our acts together: not necessarily to win, but mainly to keep from losing completely." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "No matter how you care to define it, I do not identify with the local group. Planet, species, race, nation, state, religion, party, union, club, association, neighborhood improvement committee; I have no interest in any of it. I love and treasure individuals as I meet them, I loathe and despise the groups they identify with and belong to." -- George Carlin

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "We are all alone, born alone, die alone, and -- in spite of True Romance magazines -- we shall all someday look back on our lives and see that, in spite of our company, we were alone the whole way. I do not say lonely -- at least, not all the time -- but essentially, and finally, alone. This is what makes your self-respect so important, and I don't see how you can respect yourself if you must look in the hearts and minds of others for your happiness." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "I have a theory that the truth is never told during the nine-to-five hours." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Good people drink good beer." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "I feel the same way about disco as I do about herpes." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "If you're going to be crazy, you have to get paid for it or else you're going to be locked up." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "We have become a Nazi monster in the eyes of the whole world - bullies and bastards who would rather kill than live peacefully. We are whores for power and oil with hate and fear in our hearts" -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "She was a terrible mother, there was no doubt about it, but she didn't even have the strength to feel guilty." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Gregory David Roberts
item.description: "Fate gives all of us three teachers, three friends, three enemies, and three great loves in our lives. But these twelve are always disguised, and we can never know which one is which until we’ve loved them, left them, or fought them." -- Gregory David Roberts

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Gregory David Roberts
item.description: "You know the difference between news and gossip, don't you? News tells you what people did. Gossip tells you how much they enjoyed it." -- Gregory David Roberts

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Gregory David Roberts
item.description: "The past reflects eternally between two mirrors -the bright mirror of words and deeds, and the dark one, full of things we didn't do or say." -- Gregory David Roberts

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafon
item.description: "Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafon

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "I swim against the tide because I like to annoy." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "I'm not talking to anyone, I'm delivering a monologue. It's the inebriated man's prerogative." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafon
item.description: "Presents are made for the pleasure of who gives them, not for the merits of who receives them," -- Carlos Ruiz Zafon

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "When your mother asks, "Do you want a piece of advice?" it's a mere formality. It doesn't matter if you answer yes or no. You're going to get it anyway." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "Housework is a treadmill from futility to oblivion with stop-offs at tedium and counter productivity." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "Never lend your car to anyone to whom you have given birth." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "In two decades I've lost a total of 789 pounds. I should be hanging from a charm bracelet." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "Giving birth is little more than a set of muscular contractions granting passage of a child. Then the mother is born." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "Insanity is hereditary. You can catch it from your kids." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Let's think the unthinkable, let's do the undoable. Let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something." -- Plato

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Sometimes I lie awake at night and I ask, "Is life a multiple choice test or is it a true or false test?" ...Then a voice comes to me out of the dark and says, "We hate to tell you this but life is a thousand word essay." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Take it moment by moment, and you will find that we are all, as I’ve said before, bugs in amber." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Anyway—because we are readers, we don't have to wait for some communications executive to decide what we should think about next—and how we should think about it. We can fill our heads with anything from aardvarks to zucchinis—at any time of night or day." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by Jacqueline Carey
item.description: "All paths are present, always... and we can but choose among them." -- Jacqueline Carey

item.title: Spuddie add a quote by H. L. Mencken
item.description: "Truth would quickly cease to be stranger than fiction, once we got as used to it." -- H. L. Mencken
